content.question: Which of the following most likely explains the Soviet Unionâ€™s motivation for being involved in the Congo as described in the passage?

choices.label: It wanted to establish its own colonies to extract natural resources for its industrial factories.
It wanted to take advantage of a regional conflict to expand its military power and ideological influence.
It wanted to expand its economic power by establishing free-trade agreements with dependent states.
It wanted to promote greater stability in Third World countries by ending regional conflicts.

content.answer: It wanted to take advantage of a regional conflict to expand its military power and ideological influence.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
